conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway/dollhouse-style model: walls are extruded with thickness, floor plane is distinct, and interior spaces are visible with ceiling/roof removed. Camera is only mildly tilted (near top-down), but still shows some 3D surface shading and wall top faces.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Walls have clear extrusion and thickness; corners read as 3D. Cutaway is clean. Primary weakness is the camera being close to orthographic top-down, reducing perceived verticality/side-face visibility.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency match well (living/dining/kitchen zone, two bedrooms, bath, entry/hall/closet areas). Minor proportional/layout differences and some openings (especially windows) are not as explicitly/consistently represented as in the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures are present and located logically: living seating/coffee table/rug, dining table, kitchen run, beds, and bathroom fixtures. Scale and orientation are generally consistent with the plan.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean presentation on neutral background, readable wall/floor separation, and adequate lighting. Slight softness/low contrast makes some openings and partitions less distinct.

detected_errors.description: Camera is very close to top-down, reducing apparent wall height/side faces and making the 3D read less strongly isometric than expected.
Windows/openings are not consistently clear or fully aligned with the 2D plan's window depiction (some are simplified or hard to verify).
Soft rendering/contrast slightly obscures fine geometric details (door swings/partition edges).

summary: A valid 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity and complete interiors, slightly held back by near top-down viewing and simplified/less-verifiable openings.
